podcast.name: 60-Second Science
podcast.description: Tune in every weekday for quick reports and commentaries on the world of science—it'll just take a minute

podcast_episode.title: Some Parents Show Their Kids They Care With a Corpse
podcast_episode.name: Some Parents Show Their Kids They Care With a Corpse
podcast_episode.description: <p>If you’re a silphid beetle, a dead body is all your children really want, and it's your job—no matter how difficult it is—to get it for them.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - Some Parents Show Their Kids They Care With a Corpse.

podcast_episode.title: How to Handle This New COVID Season
podcast_episode.name: How to Handle This New COVID Season
podcast_episode.description: <p>The dangerous virus is still here. Here’s how you can stay safe.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - How to Handle This New COVID Season.

podcast_episode.title: As Arctic Sea Ice Breaks Up, AI Is Starting to Predict Where the Ice Will Go
podcast_episode.name: As Arctic Sea Ice Breaks Up, AI Is Starting to Predict Where the Ice Will Go
podcast_episode.description: <p>Sea ice is changing fast. Are forecasts, created by artificial intelligence, the best way to keep up with the pace of a warming climate in the far north?</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - As Arctic Sea Ice Breaks Up, AI Is Starting to Predict Where the Ice Will Go.

podcast_episode.title: Scientists Argue Conservation Is under Threat in Indonesia
podcast_episode.name: Scientists Argue Conservation Is under Threat in Indonesia
podcast_episode.description: <p>Researchers have been banned from working in Indonesia’s tropical rain forests after the government disagreed with their scientific conclusions.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - Scientists Argue Conservation Is under Threat in Indonesia.

podcast_episode.title: A Soggy Mission to Sniff Out a Greenhouse Gas 'Bomb' in the High Arctic
podcast_episode.name: A Soggy Mission to Sniff Out a Greenhouse Gas 'Bomb' in the High Arctic
podcast_episode.description: <p>A needle-like tower, hung with sensors, "sniffs" the air above the Arctic circle for signs of catastrophic thaw in the sodden ground below.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - A Soggy Mission to Sniff Out a Greenhouse Gas 'Bomb' in the High Arctic.

podcast_episode.title: This Indigenous Community Records the Climate Change That Is Causing Their Town to Erode Away
podcast_episode.name: This Indigenous Community Records the Climate Change That Is Causing Their Town to Erode Away
podcast_episode.description: <p>In a tiny village north of the Arctic Circle in Canada, the Inuvialuit of Tuktoyaktuk have taken climate science into their own hands. </p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - This Indigenous Community Records the Climate Change That Is Causing Their Town to Erode Away.

podcast_episode.title: Journey to the Thawing Edge of Climate Change
podcast_episode.name: Journey to the Thawing Edge of Climate Change
podcast_episode.description: <p>What is a permafrost thaw slump? Just imagine a massive hole with an area the size of more than nine football fields—and growing—where ice-cold ground once stood.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - Journey to the Thawing Edge of Climate Change.

podcast_episode.title: A Popular Decongestant Doesn't Work. What Does?
podcast_episode.name: A Popular Decongestant Doesn't Work. What Does?
podcast_episode.description: <p>The popular decongestant phenylephrine is not effective, an FDA panel found. Here’s what to use instead.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - A Popular Decongestant Doesn't Work. What Does?.

podcast_episode.title: The State of Large Language Models
podcast_episode.name: The State of Large Language Models
podcast_episode.description: <p>We present the latest updates on ChatGPT, Bard and other competitors in the artificial intelligence arms race.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - The State of Large Language Models.

podcast_episode.title: Song of the Stars, Part 3: The Universe in all Senses
podcast_episode.name: Song of the Stars, Part 3: The Universe in all Senses
podcast_episode.description: <p>An astronomy festival in Italy opted to make all of its events and workshops multisensory. They wanted to see whether sound, touch and smell can, like sight, transmit the wonders of the cosmos.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - Song of the Stars, Part 3: The Universe in all Senses.

podcast.name: Plays Well with Others
podcast.description: From Creative Commons, a podcast about the art and science of collaboration. With a focus on the tools, techniques, and mechanics of collaboration, we explore how today's most interesting collaborators are making new things, solving old problems, and getting things done — together. Hosted by Creative Commons CEO Ryan Merkley.

podcast_episode.title: What Do an Army of Ants and an Online Encyclopedia Have in Common?
podcast_episode.name: What Do an Army of Ants and an Online Encyclopedia Have in Common?
podcast_episode.filename: Plays Well with Others - What Do an Army of Ants and an Online Encyclopedia Have in Common?.m4a

podcast_episode.title: I Laughed So Hard I Cried
podcast_episode.name: I Laughed So Hard I Cried
podcast_episode.filename: Plays Well with Others - I Laughed So Hard I Cried.m4a

podcast_episode.title: Coming Soon
podcast_episode.name: Coming Soon
podcast_episode.description: <p>From Creative Commons, a new podcast about the art and science of collaboration. With a focus on the tools, techniques, and mechanics of collaboration, we’re going to explore how today's most interesting collaborators are making new things, solving old problems, and getting things done — together. Hosted by Creative Commons CEO Ryan Merkley. Premieres Tuesday, February 19.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: Plays Well with Others - Coming Soon.mp3

podcast.name: Trace
podcast.description: An investigative podcast hosted by ABC journalist Rachael Brown, Trace examines the fractures in Australia's criminal justice system, and the decades-long ripples they have caused.
podcast.copyright: Copyright 2023, Australian Broadcasting Corporation. All right reserved.

podcast_episode.title: Maria James inquest finding
podcast_episode.name: Maria James inquest finding
podcast_episode.description: A Victorian Coroner has failed to name a killer in the 1980 cold case of Maria James. Her sons are devasted. But there's still hope, in leads yet to be chased by police.

podcast_episode.title: S1 | The Inquest
podcast_episode.name: S1 | The Inquest
podcast_episode.description: The new coronial inquest into the murder of Maria James has wrapped up. Will the Coroner be able to name her killer? And of the police exhibits that haven't disappeared, what DNA testing can be done? This episode nears us closer to the end of the James brothers' 41-year-fight for answers for their mum.

podcast_episode.title: S1 | Breakthrough in Maria James cold case
podcast_episode.name: S1 | Breakthrough in Maria James cold case
podcast_episode.description: The discovery of a police exhibit - thought to be missing for around three decades - could finally help unmask the killer in the 1980 cold case of Maria James.
podcast_episode.filename: Trace - S1 | Breakthrough in Maria James cold case.

podcast_episode.title: S2 BONUS — The Price
podcast_episode.name: S2 BONUS — The Price
podcast_episode.description: The Royal Commission has released its final report into defence lawyer turned police informer Nicola Gobbo.

podcast_episode.title: S2 08 | End game
podcast_episode.name: S2 08 | End game
podcast_episode.description: We reveal the story of Nicola Gobbo's audacious bid to return to Australia.

podcast_episode.title: S2 07 | Reckoning
podcast_episode.name: S2 07 | Reckoning
podcast_episode.description: Everything unravels, for Nicola Gobbo and Victoria Police. Their secret is out.

podcast_episode.title: S2 06 | Whatever it takes
podcast_episode.name: S2 06 | Whatever it takes
podcast_episode.description: Nicola hits rock bottom, but Victoria Police wants her to take on a new role ... as a witness.

podcast_episode.title: S2 05 | Glittering prize
podcast_episode.name: S2 05 | Glittering prize
podcast_episode.description: Nicola wants to be the best source ever, and she leads police to the biggest target of all: the mafia. Her double life is getting riskier, but she can't stop. This episode charts an addiction and a crash.

podcast_episode.title: S2 04 | Rubicon
podcast_episode.name: S2 04 | Rubicon
podcast_episode.description: Nicola crosses the point of no return and becomes a police informer. She'll represent clients, while passing on the underworld's secrets to Victoria Police.

podcast_episode.title: S2 03 | The darkest night
podcast_episode.name: S2 03 | The darkest night
podcast_episode.description: A drug house burglary smells of police corruption and a police informer is executed.

podcast_episode.title: S2 02 | One of the crew
podcast_episode.name: S2 02 | One of the crew
podcast_episode.description: As the gangland war explodes, both police and criminals start questioning Nicola's allegiances. Where do her loyalties lie?
podcast_episode.filename: Trace - S2 02 | One of the crew.

podcast_episode.title: S2 01 | Nicola
podcast_episode.name: S2 01 | Nicola
podcast_episode.description: We meet Nicola Gobbo in a secret location, in hiding, now that her double life as a police informer is out, and she begins telling us her full story.

podcast_episode.title: INTRODUCING Trace season 2 - The Informer
podcast_episode.name: INTRODUCING Trace season 2 - The Informer
podcast_episode.description: Lawyer Nicola Gobbo represented some of Australia's most dangerous criminals, all the while secretly working as a police informer. Why did she do it?
podcast_episode.filename: Trace - INTRODUCING Trace season 2 - The Informer.

podcast_episode.title: S1 07 | Hope
podcast_episode.name: S1 07 | Hope
podcast_episode.description:
More than a year on from their plea for a new coronial inquest, the James brothers get a decision.
Will they finally get answers to the burning questions they've carried for 38 years about the murder of their mother?
And what about those items Trace has been given that might have DNA on them?
Can they identify the killer?
We take them to one of the world's best DNA labs, with some of the most sensitive equipment, to find out.

podcast_episode.title: S1 06 | Limbo
podcast_episode.name: S1 06 | Limbo
podcast_episode.description:
New evidence has been found. So can police test it for a trace of the killer? What happened to crucial documents? And a new confession.
It is nearly a year since the James brothers applied for a new coronial inquest into their mum's murder, but the case hangs in legal limbo.

podcast_episode.title: S1 05 | Wait
podcast_episode.name: S1 05 | Wait
podcast_episode.description: The fall-out from major revelations in the Maria James cold-case continue, as her sons make a desperate plea to the Coroner.

podcast_episode.title: S1 04 | DNA
podcast_episode.name: S1 04 | DNA
podcast_episode.description: There's a major break in the case, as Trace uncovers a police bungle in the murder of Maria James. But it only serves to throw up more questions than answers, as the James brothers continue their desperate search for justice.

podcast_episode.title: S1 03 | Sins
podcast_episode.name: S1 03 | Sins
podcast_episode.description: A second person of interest emerges within the church. Rachael Brown investigates their past and discovers a dark and disturbing history.

podcast_episode.title: BONUS | How your leads are helping the investigation
podcast_episode.name: BONUS | How your leads are helping the investigation
podcast_episode.description: Since Trace was first released, the ABC has received over 50 emails from the community with leads and tip offs. In this bonus update, reporter Rachael Brown follows up with two women who got in touch to say they saw men acting suspiciously around Maria's bookshop at the time of her murder. Send us your tips: trace@abc.net.au
podcast_episode.filename: Trace - BONUS | How your leads are helping the investigation.

podcast_episode.title: S1 02 | Confessions
podcast_episode.name: S1 02 | Confessions
podcast_episode.description: Rachael Brown's investigation into the death of Maria James turns to the local Church, and Rachael tracks down a new witness who saw someone covered in blood around the time of Maria's death.

podcast_episode.title: S1 01 | Bookshop murder
podcast_episode.name: S1 01 | Bookshop murder
podcast_episode.description: On a winter morning in June 1980, Maria James turned to her son Mark and looked him in the eyes. "If anything happens to me, look after your brother." Later that day she was found stabbed to death at the back of her suburban Melbourne bookshop.

podcast_episode.title: S1 | Preview
podcast_episode.name: S1 | Preview
podcast_episode.description: June, 1980, suburban Melbourne: Mother of two Maria James is stabbed to death in the back of her bookshop. Her killer has never been found. Was it a scorned lover? A random stranger? Or was Maria's murder tied up in the sins of the Catholic Church?
